list_definition.definition: a woman’s dress, especially one of high quality for dances, parties etc
a loose robe worn by clergymen, lawyers, teachers etc.

list_ex_of_english: The coupon rates for dressing gowns are: men's and women's—7 coupons; boys' and girls'—6 coupons; infants'—4 coupons.
We need a little ceremony and decorum, and the wigs and gowns add to the dignity of our proceedings.
Dressing gowns must be fire resistant — unless they are made of terry towelling.
I hope that there will be no disagreement that we should continue to wear gowns.
They studied a group of patients who did not wear the gowns on one day and then wore the gowns on another.
We could have had the red gowns of doctors for important occasions.
The real test is whether the wearing of wigs and gowns actually assists in the administration of justice.
Indeed, she hoards when she sequesters valuable silk gowns in the clotheschest from which they emerge later, in order of antiquity, to be worn spotted with mold.
